IM401.name: Clinical Emergency Medicine Research I
IM401.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
IM401.description: Participation in multiple research projects at an off-campus hospital. Experience in data collection and analysis. Emphasis on writing reports covering topics in emergency medicine.
IM401.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of department.

IM590.name: Special Problems in Internal Medicine
IM590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM590.description: Students work under faculty direction on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.
IM590.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of department.

IM602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
IM602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

IM603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
IM603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM618.name: Clinical Tropical Medicine
IM618.description: Selected topics such as African AIDS, malaria, onchocerciasis, tuberculosis, and schistosomiasis. Pathophysiology, treatments, epidemiology, current research, and controversies.

IM619.name: Readiness for Residency: A Simulation Based Competency Skills Assessment
IM619.description: A simulation and classroom based rotation to assess procedural and communication skills.
IM619.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM621.name: Clinical Tropical Medicine Clerkship
IM621.description: Supervised clinical experiences in a large African teaching hospital and its outpatient clinics; students must spend at least six weeks on site. Small group discussions led by MSU faculty.
IM621.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM650.name: Core Internal Medicine In-Patient Clerkship
IM650.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM650.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic internal medicine in the hospital setting. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
IM650.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM651.name: Cardiology Clerkship
IM651.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM651.description: Intensive experience in bedside diagnosis and care of patients with the more frequently seen cardiac problems.
IM651.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM652.name: Gastroenterology Clerkship
IM652.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM652.description: Inpatient and outpatient clinical gastroenterology. GI diseases. Patient evaluation and management. Behavioral science and patient care.
IM652.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students or osteopathic medicine students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM653.name: Oncology and Hematology Clerkship
IM653.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM653.description: Diagnosis, staging, and treatment methods of solid tumors and other neoplasms. Pharmacology of cytotoxic agents. Issues in nutrition. Behavioral approaches to the terminally ill patient.
IM653.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM654.name: Pulmonary Disease Clerkship
IM654.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM654.description: Evaluation and treatment of patients with common pulmonary diseases including acute and chronic respiratory failure, primary and metastatic lung tumors, various bacterial and non-bacterial pneumonias.
IM654.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM655.name: Nephrology Clerkship
IM655.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM655.description: Clinic and hospital based experience to develop basic skills in evaluation and management of patients with renal disease. Integration of renal physiology and pathophysiology.
IM655.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM657.name: Core Emergency Medicine Clerkship
IM657.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM657.description: Acute evaluation and management of patients in the hospital emergency department and other locations.
IM657.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM658.name: Core Internal Medicine Out-Patient Clerkship
IM658.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM658.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic internal medicine in the out-patient setting. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
IM658.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM659.name: Medical Critical Care Clerkship
IM659.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM659.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic medical critical care (distinct from surgical critical care). Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
IM659.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM660.name: Core Internal Medical Sub-Internship
IM660.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM660.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic internal medicine. Proficiency in advanced motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
IM660.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM661.name: Internal Medical Specialty Clerkship
IM661.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM661.description: Clinical exposure in osteopathic internal medicine subspecialty rotations. Proficiency in motor skills and aptitudes; comprehension of concepts and principles; patient evaluation; diagnosis; management; therapy.
IM661.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM662.name: Urgent Care Clerkship
IM662.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM662.description: Acute evaluation and management of patients in the outpatient urgent care setting
IM662.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM663.name: Emergency Medicine/Wilderness/Austere Medicine Clerkship
IM663.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM663.description: Acute evaluation and management of patients in the austere environment – wilderness or other location, including disaster medicine, and emergency medicine system.
IM663.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM664.name: Pediatric Emergency Medicine Clerkship
IM664.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM664.description: Acute evaluation and management of patients in the hospital based pediatric emergency department.
IM664.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM665.name: Emergency Medicine Advanced Clerkship
IM665.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM665.description: Advanced acute evaluation and management of patients in the hospital emergency department and other locations.
IM665.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM666.name: Emergency Medicine Toxicology
IM666.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM666.description: Evaluation and management of patients who suffer from an exposure to any form of toxins, the typical clinical presentation, evaluation and management including antidotes.
IM666.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM667.name: Emergency Medicine Hyperbaric Medicine and Wound Management
IM667.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM667.description: Management of wounds from all causes, including the use of a hyperbaric chamber as a treatment strategy.
IM667.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM668.name: Emergency Medicine EMS and Disaster Management
IM668.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM668.description: Emergency Medical Services and Disaster Management designed to expose the student to multiple facets of emergency care in the community and outside the emergency department, including community disaster preparedness.
IM668.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM669.name: Emergency Medicine Ultrasound
IM669.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM669.description: Bedside ultrasound, integrating curriculum related to the physics and orientation of ultrasound images to obtaining images at the bedside to begin a portfolio.
IM669.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

IM690.name: Internal Medicine Clerkship Essentials
IM690.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
IM690.description: Case-based review of essential topics in internal medicine
IM690.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
